intro: Clarkia purpurea, commonly known as the purple clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, showy pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and rocky slopes. It has slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Clarkia purpurea is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also an important nectar source for pollinators.
